meanings.sent1: The tridental fork was perfect for picking up small pieces of fruit.
meanings.sent2: The tridental crown on the statue symbolized power and strength.
meanings.sent3: The tridental comb made the cat look like a tiny warrior.
meanings.sent4: Her tridental hairpin held her bun securely in place.
meanings.sent5: The tridental shape of the snowflake was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A weapon or tool with three prongs or points.
meanings.sent1: He used a tridental to dig up the stubborn weeds in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The tridental was a versatile tool for fishing in the shallow waters.
meanings.sent3: The chef's tridental was his secret weapon for flipping pancakes flawlessly.
meanings.sent4: The tridental of Poseidon was said to control the seas.
meanings.sent5: The tridental gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: Resembling a trident in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The tridental clouds in the sky looked like giant forks.
meanings.sent2: The tridental leaves of the plant added an exotic touch to the garden.
meanings.sent3: The tridental shadows on the wall made the room feel whimsical.
meanings.sent4: Her tridental earrings sparkled under the lights.
meanings.sent5: The tridental pattern on the fabric was unique and eye-catching.
